description:
Roles and Responsibilities:

 Create and maintain an inventory of all documentation required for the project
 Develop/produce Project and Operational documentation
 Provide project team oversight on key project deliverables
 Liaise with key Project stakeholders, SSC Service Lines and also external stakeholders and contract vendor to provide assessments, recommendations and strategies to Project Director and SSC senior management.
 Liaise with Project team members and Operational staff in the development of documentation
 Identify Project issues and gaps during the documentation process; raise and escalate the issues as required
 Plan, schedule and facilitate white-boarding sessions to develop operational processes (including participants from multiple organizational groups)
 Solicit, collect and consolidate feedback on documentation and other project artefacts
 Ensure that feedback is addressed, vetted and included in subsequent document revisionsConsolidate, edit and provide Quality Assurance for Project team reviews of contract deliverables
 Ensure that all documentation is prepared according to project schedules
 Secure document approvals from Project and Operations stakeholders and executives
 Manage the Change Request and Service Request processes for amendments to Project and Contractor documentation.

Qualifications:

 More than 15 years experience generating technical documentation
 More than 15 years experience in Telecommunications industry (Government of Canada and/or Private Sector)
 A university degree from an accredited institution

Job Type: Contract
Salary: $60,000.00-$100,000.00 per year
Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
